title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, is interviewed about his work in the field of misinformation and disinformation, specifically focusing on coordinated inauthentic behavior. He discusses how coordination between social media actors writing certain content is a signal to spot mis- and disinformation. He also mentions his 2020 research on coordinated link sharing behavior related to COVID-19 in Italy.
description: An interview with Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, discussing his research on misinformation and disinformation, specifically focusing on coordinated inauthentic behavior and his 2020 research on COVID-19 related link sharing in Italy.

title: Panel TRANSFORMATIVE TOOLS, EMERGING CHALLENGES: EMPIRICAL AND PRACTICAL EXPERIENCES WITH LARGE LANGUAGE MODELS FOR TEXT CLASSIF - AoIR Selected Papers of Internet Research
snippet: Fabio Giglietto and colleagues presented a paper reflecting on their investigation of the role of social media in shaping exposure to political news during the 2018 and 2022 Italian elections, using large language models (LLMs) to address methodological challenges.
description: This paper presented at AoIR mentions Fabio Giglietto and his colleagues' research on using large language models to analyze social media's role in shaping exposure to political news during the 2018 and 2022 Italian elections.

title: Insights and Report from the Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference - Vera.ai
snippet: Fabio Giglietto and Giada Marino presented insights from the vera.ai Alerts project, which tracked and analyzed coordinated accounts on Facebook. Their research identified coordinated posts, links, and new coordinated accounts, with notable activity in large groups and networks.
description: This article reports on the Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference and specifically mentions Fabio Giglietto and Giada Marino presenting insights from the vera.ai Alerts project, which analyzed coordinated accounts on Facebook, aligning with his research in social media and disinformation.

title: D4.2 - Coordinated sharing behaviour detection and disinformation campaign modelling methods - AWS
snippet: This report mentions an expert opinion authored by Fabio Giglietto. It also references research from the University of Urbino that uncovered a large-scale disinformation campaign on Facebook surrounding Pope Francis's health.
description: This report mentions Fabio Giglietto's expert opinion and references research from the University of Urbino on a disinformation campaign related to Pope Francis's health on Facebook, indicating direct relevance to his expertise.

title: Mis and Disinformation in Global Health Symposium - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: Fabio Giglietto presented research from his group at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo on coordinated link sharing behavior in Nigeria and India, discussing how they detected coordinated networks and analyzed content from various news websites.
description: The content discusses Fabio Giglietto's presentation at the Mis and Disinformation in Global Health Symposium, where he presented research from his group at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo on coordinated link sharing behavior in Nigeria and India.
